title: Calorimetry experiment to determine heat capacity

content.question: Based on the information in the table, what is the specific heat capacity of the metal?

choices.label: <math alttext="0.042 joule per gram degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.042</mn><mtext> J</mtext><mo>/</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>g·°C</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>
<math alttext="0.35 joule per gram degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.35</mn><mtext> J</mtext><mo>/</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>g·°C</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>
<math alttext="0.46 joule per gram degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.46</mn><mtext> J</mtext><mo>/</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>g·°C</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>
<math alttext="1.39 joules per gram degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.39</mn><mtext> J</mtext><mo>/</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>g·°C</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="0.46 joule per gram degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.46</mn><mtext> J</mtext><mo>/</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>g·°C</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
